verses.verse: King Ahasuerus imposed tribute throughout the land to its distant shores.
And all his acts of power and might, as well as an account of the greatness of Mordecai, whom the king promoted, are set down in the book of the annals of the kings of Media and Persia.

Mordecai the Jew was second in rank to King Ahasuerus, preeminent among the Jews, and held in high esteem by his fellow Jews because he worked for the good of his people and was the herald of peace for his whole race. Epilogue Chapter F Mordecai’s Dream Fulfilled.[h] 1 Then Mordecai said: “All this is God’s doing, 2 for I remember the dream I had about these events, and not one of them has failed to be fulfilled—the tiny spring that became a river, the light that shone, the sun, the abundance of water. The river is Esther, whom the king married and established as queen.
